alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 06 at 2:41AM MST until March 06 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 6 PM TODAY FOR THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... .Though winds will not be as strong as Sunday, west to southwest winds will remain breezy to locally windy through this afternoon. The combination of these winds with several hours of single digit humidity, above average temperatures, and receptive fuels will lead to critical fire weather conditions for much of northeast New Mexico as well as the Central Highlands. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), and Central Highlands (Zone 125) from mid morning through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west at 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity of 5 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
